title.a: Greater Alarm Structure Fire - Now Out 06/28/2024 INC#1639

item.description: Greater Alarm Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1639; 08:15PM; 141 N Alvarado St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/45Ln4Jm" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/45Ln4Jm</a>; #Westlake; First arriving 32 LAFD Firefighters took just 20 minutes (8:35 PM) to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in one first floor unit of a two-story garden style apartment building serving as No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 20; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC2 CM20 CM22 E11 E20 E203 E211 E220 E227 E235 E27 E3 E35 E6 EM1 EM11 EM5 HR3 RA10 RA11 RA27 RA3 RA803 RA827 SO1 SQ21 T11 T20 T27 T3 T35 T9 UR27 UR88 ; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey
item.category: Greater Alarm Structure Fire - Now Out

item.description: Fully Contained - Brush Fire; INC#1388; 07:45PM; 15700 W Burbank Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RG8PQg" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RG8PQg</a>; #SepulvedaBasin; This wildland blaze, known as the "Burbank Fire", has been fully contained at 2 1/4 (2.25) acres. All LAFD helicopters have been released, and ground-based LAFD operations will continue tonight to monitor and fully extinguish any active flame within the perimeter. There has been no infra/structure damage, no evacuation and no injuries. Closure of all traffic lanes (eastbound and westbound) Burbank Boulevard between Woodley Avenue and the 405 Freeway will continue tonight until LAFD operations are complete. Unknown ETO. Travelers are asked to continue to avoid the area, expect congestion and consider an alternate route. The specific cause of the fire has yet to be determined.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC14 CE83 DZ45 E100 E288 E290 E39 E83 E88 E90 EM17 H3 H4 H6 HA3 HA4 HA6 HE5 RA100 RA83 RA88 T88 T90 WT88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Contained - Brush Fire; INC#1388; 07:20PM; 15700 W Burbank Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RG8PQg" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RG8PQg</a>; #SepulvedaBasin; A series of precise LAFD helicopter water drops have contained the perimeter of the (yet to be determined size) blaze in thick underbrush of the Sepulveda Basin Recreation Area, south of the intersection of Burbank Boulevard and Woodley Avenue. 32 LAFD Firefighters will continue their largely defensive ground-based operations tonight to fully extinguish all active flame within the perimeter. There has been no infra/structure damage, no evacuation and no injuries reported. Closure of all traffic lanes (eastbound and westbound) Burbank Boulevard between Woodley Avenue and the 405 Freeway will continue tonight until LAFD operations are complete. Unknown ETO. Travelers are asked to avoid the area, expect congestion and consider an alternate route. An investigation into the specific cause of the fire will commence upon full fire extinguishment.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC14 CE83 E100 E288 E290 E39 E83 E88 E90 EM17 H3 H4 H6 HA3 HA4 HA6 RA100 RA83 RA88 T88 T90 WT88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1388; 05:44PM; 15700 W Burbank Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RG8PQg" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RG8PQg</a>; #SepulvedaBasin; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response in largely defensive operations to less than one (1) acre of grass burning on the southeast corner of Burbank Boulevard and Woodley Avenue in the Sepulveda Basin Recreation Area. Moderate rate of spread with light winds at 10-15 MPH out of the southwest. No current infra/structure threat. No evacuation. No injuries reported. Closure of all traffic lanes (eastbound and westbound) on Burbank Boulevard between Woodley Avenue and the 405 Freeway until LAFD operations are complete. Unknown ETO. Travelers, expect congestion and consider an alternate route.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC14 CE83 E100 E288 E290 E39 E83 E88 E90 EM17 H3 H4 H6 HA3 HA4 HA6 RA83 T88 T90 WT88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/27/2024 INC#1663

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1663; 08:24PM; 10924 S Broadway St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3L3wc2o" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3L3wc2o</a>; #BroadwayManchester; The first arriving 45 Los Angeles Firefighters took just 21 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in two units (one upstairs and one downstairs) of the 5,700 square foot, 18 unit, two-story U-shaped garden-style "Economy Motel". LAFD Firefighters assisted in the evacuation and medical care of four civilians (undetermined affiliation). Three (36F, 15F, 13F) sustained smoke inhalation and one (36M) has smoke inhalation and burns to his extremities. All have been taken by LAFD Paramedic ambulances to an area hospital in fair condition. No other injuries have been reported. LAFD Public Information Officer Firefighter David Ortiz is en route - ETA 9:00 PM. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. ; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC4 CM20 CM22 E205 E233 E264 E266 E33 E46 E5 E57 E64 E65 E79 EM1 EM11 EM13 EM5 HR3 PI4 RA246 RA264 RA266 RA46 RA64 RA65 RA79 RA864 SO1 SQ21 T33 T5 T64 T66 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/27/2024 INC#1663

item.description: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1663; 08:03PM; 10924 S Broadway St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3L3wc2o" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3L3wc2o</a>; #BroadwayManchester; During their offensive fire attack, first arriving LAFD Firefighters have rescued at least four civilian burn patients from the two-story garden-style motel. The well-coordinated firefight continues at what is now considered a greater alarm fire.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC4 CM20 CM22 E205 E233 E264 E266 E33 E46 E5 E57 E64 E65 E79 EM1 EM11 EM13 EM5 HR3 RA246 RA264 RA46 RA64 RA65 RA864 SQ21 T33 T5 T64 T66 UR5 UR88; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0119; 02:21AM; 1935 S La Salle Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RHuxDq" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RHuxDq</a>; #HarvardHeights; 48 LAFD Firefighters took 32 minutes (2:53 AM) to extinguish fire in one second floor unit of a 29,000 square foot three-story 33 unit garden style apartment building, with slight extension to the unit above. No injury. Fire cause under investigation. ; FS 26; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 E11 E13 E15 E211 E215 E226 E26 RA13 RA26 RA826 SQ21 T11 T15 T26; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

No injury.
